nodes.bodyText: why an empty tolerates clause here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jsonpInternal-2.0
+visibility=private
+-features=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jsonpImpl-2.0.0; ibm.tolerates:=""

nodes.bodyText: I left that on purpose to indicate no tolerations.  It is vestigial and I've no problem removing the clause.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jsonpInternal-2.0
+visibility=private
+-features=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jsonpImpl-2.0.0; ibm.tolerates:=""

nodes.bodyText: Lets discuss this on our upcoming call, but I think we will still need to create a jsonpImpl-2.0.1 feature and have it tolerated

nodes.bodyText: perhaps now would be the time to create a javaeeCompatible-9.0 feature?

@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@

+visibility=private

+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jakarta.cdi-3.0,\

nodes.bodyText: Yes.  Remember from previous meetings that the feature will be named eeCompatible-9.0.

nodes.bodyText: Yes.  Remember from previous meetings that the feature will be named eeCompatible-9.0.  The feature is added.  All jakarta features in the working branch to date that declared a dependency on javaeeCompatible-8.0 were changed to eeCompatible-9.0.

nodes.bodyText: The version of Yasson that will support EE9 will be Yasson 2.0, so we can name the bundle accordingly: com.ibm.ws.org.eclipse.yasson.2.0
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+# This private impl feature corresponds to JSON-B 2.0 with the Yasson implementation
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jsonbImpl-2.0.0
+singleton=true
+visibility=private
+-features=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jsonp-2.0, \
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.classloading-1.0, \
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.jakarta.cdi-3.0,\
+  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.javaeeCompatible-8.0
+-bundles=com.ibm.ws.org.eclipse.yasson.1.0.jakarta, \

nodes.bodyText: The yasson.1.0.jakarta bundle is the jakartaee-enabled bundle generated by the yasson.1.0/bnd.bnd file, below.  We'll revisit this.  If we can obtain a jakarta release of yasson, we'll add it to CNF, create a v2.0 bundle project, and modify this feature dependency accordingly.

nodes.bodyText: what does this do?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -28,3 +28,5 @@ instrument.disabled: true
     org.hamcrest:hamcrest-all;version=1.3, \
     org.jmock:jmock-junit4;strategy=exact;version=2.5.1, \
     org.jmock:jmock;strategy=exact;version=2.5.1
+    
+jakartaeeMe: true

nodes.bodyText: jakartaeeMe causes the build to create the jakartaee-enabled version of the yasson-1.0 bundle, which is used by feature jsonbImpl-2.0.0.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -28,3 +28,5 @@ instrument.disabled: true
     org.hamcrest:hamcrest-all;version=1.3, \
     org.jmock:jmock-junit4;strategy=exact;version=2.5.1, \
     org.jmock:jmock;strategy=exact;version=2.5.1
+    
+jakartaeeMe: true

nodes.bodyText: This package export should be at version 2.0.0 instead of 1.0.17
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/rejar.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-SymbolicName: com.ibm.ws.org.glassfish.json.2.0
+
+Export-Package: \
+   org.glassfish.json.*;version="1.0.17"

nodes.bodyText: Currently this bundle project is vestigial, fyi.  Changing the export to v2.0 at this time will cause wiring problems.  We need to change this after removing the jsonp-2.0 dependency on the transformed glassfish-1.0 bundle.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/rejar.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-SymbolicName: com.ibm.ws.org.glassfish.json.2.0
+
+Export-Package: \
+   org.glassfish.json.*;version="1.0.17"
